results.title: The Games: the millennium bug
results.creator_credit: Bruce Permezel, Denise Eriksen, ABC-TV (Australia) and Beyond Productions
results.brief_description: The first four episodes from the ABC comedy documentary series, The Games. Episode 1: John and Gina meet the Sydney spindoctors while Bryan finds the unbelievable - a willing sponsor with millions to spend. Episode 2: John confronts the threat of the Millenium Bug, and finds a worldwide audience for The Games on the Net. Episode 3: Our team goes bush to a conference centre to workshop the problems they face at The Games. Episode 4: The consultants are out to get Bryan but our team proves that home-grown expertise can beat corporate slickness any day. Written by John Clarke and Ross Stevenson.

results.title: The Games: sharing the blame
results.creator_credit: Bruce Permezel, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Finishing Touches Productions
results.brief_description: This video contains four episodes from series two of the outstanding ABC series “The Games”, a satirical (but often painfully close to the truth) mock documentary of SOCOG and their preparations for the Sydney 2000 Olympic Games. The episodes included cover the following issues: an in-depth look at the lives of some of the main players behind the scenes of the Committee; what happens when everything is running according to schedule; the life story of one (or perhaps two) of the many thousands of international guests who will come to see the Games; the use of inquiries to ensure that the accidental misuse of process by Committee members is quickly exposed and rectified.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruce Permezel, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Finishing Touches Productions

results.title: The Games
results.creator_credit: Bruce Permezel, ABC-TV (Australia), Beyond Productions, John Clarke and Ross Stevenson
results.brief_description: A mock documentary about how not to prepare for the Sydney Olympics, or any Olympics for that matter. This tape includes four episodes from the popular television satire. Incidents arising from the episodes include; accuracy, in particular the construction of the 100 metre track; the importance of flying with approved airlines and what happens when two international figures arrive on a non official airline; John appears on television defending Australia’s position on the environment while Bryan and Gina hear a proposal from rural Australia regarding the opening ceremony; there are moves to bring in an infallible drug test to the Olympics, but will it bring more harm than good? Cast includes John Clarke, Gina Riley and Bryan Dawe.

results.title: The Game
results.creator_credit: Les Clark, Ken Peterson and Walt Disney Educational Materials
results.brief_description: An animated film made for children, which poses the questions - how come some kids never play by the rules? Why do they always wan special treatment? Should the rules be changed? Various alternatives are offered for each problem but the real answers will be those which arise from group discussions.

results.title: The Fun gap
results.creator_credit: John King, Derek Wright and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: A comprehensive look at the types of sporting activities being provided to the intellectually and physically handicapped of all ages. Special education staff and the participants themselves, including two hearing-impaired people, a young paraplegic, a blind yachtsman and some aged persons, comment on the benefits they perceive in taking part.

results.title: The Frog prince (Muppets)
results.creator_credit: Jim Henson, Henson Associates and Robert Lawrence Productions
results.brief_description: Sir Robin, the bravest prince is turned into a frog by an ogre. The only cure to revert him to his human form is to receive a kiss from a Princess, to lift the spell. Starring Trudy Young as the Princess and Gordon Thomson as the Prince, as well as the muppet performers.

results.title: The French Foreign Legion
results.creator_credit: Michael du Monceau, Mathieu Mazza, Adler Enterprises and Newsgroup
results.brief_description: This video covers the history of the French Foreign Legion, an army of mercenaries whose sense of honour and loyalty transcends national boundaries and commands respect as one of the world’s elite fighting forces. The Legionnaire’s loyalty is to the corps and not to France. They are often loathed by the French as unwelcome foreigners but equally, Legionnaires are considered useful for fighting and dying on behalf of the French in their colonial wars in Africa, Vietnam and various other French colonies across the world. More than 35,000 Legionnaires have died in battle with 8,000 alone being killed at the siege of Dien Bien Phu in Vietnam in 1954. The men who make up the French Foreign Legion are an enigma, often hated and despised for their mercenary attitude by some but highly respected for their fighting skills and effectiveness in battle, particularly guerilla warfare by others - all dependent upon your political and social point of view. Includes interviews, newsreels, stills, historic film footage of many of the battles fought in the 20th century around the world and rare behind-the-scenes footage of Legionnaires in training and in combat including frontline footage during Operation Desert Storm in the Gulf. Narrated by Jackson Bain. Contains some b&w footage.

results.title: The Fox and the hound
results.creator_credit: Richard Rich, Ted Berman, Wolfgang Reitherman, Art Stevens and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: This classic Disney tale is a heartwarming story of two best friends who didn’t know they were supposed to be enemies. Orphaned fox cub Tod is adopted by a lonely widow, and the fun and adventure begins when he meets Copper, an adorable hound puppy. Under the watchful eyes of Big Mama Owl, the innocent pair play and frolic in the forest, becoming inseparable friends - each unaware that the future will see them pitted against each other as each must fulfill his role in the scheme of things. Reflecting such timeless values as love, courage and the importance of friendship, and featuring the vocal talents of Mickey Rooney, Kurt Russell, Sandy Duncan, Pearl Bailey and Corey Feldman, this is a very endearing movie for the young and the young at heart.

results.title: The Forsyte saga (2002) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Christopher Menaul, Sita Williams and Granada Television International
results.brief_description: Originally produced in 1967 by the BBC, John Galsworthy’s popular novel of life in early 20th century London as seen through the eyes of the Forsyte family is given a fresh injection of talent and production values in this 2002 Granada Television mini-series. Set in Victorian England, sex, corruption, greed and jealousy characterise the machinations and minutiae of two branches of the same family, headed by the patriarchs Jolyon (Corin Redgrave) and James (John Carlisle) Forsyte. Cast includes: Damian Lewis, Rupert Graves, Gina McKee, Corin Redgrave, Ioan Gruffudd. Written by Stephen Mallatratt.

results.title: The Forests and Vladimir Krajina
results.creator_credit: Peter Katadotis, Tom Radford, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Visually seductive, this film uncovers a few hard truths under the packaging. Dr. Vladimir Krajina, botanist and teacher, is waging a successful battle in British Columbia for the creation of ecological reserves. He explains the importance of such sanctuaries and why people must know and respect nature’s laws if the future needs of the industry and the desire for a high quality of life are to be reconciled. Written by Barry Cowling and narrated by Stanley Jackson.
